sentence.Network_en: Infectious diseases are spreading among many of the flood victims.
sentence.Network_cn: 传染病正在遭受洪灾的很多灾民中蔓延。

sentence.Network_en: Word has been spreading fast of the incidents on the streets.
sentence.Network_cn: 有关街头骚乱的消息迅速传播开来。

sentence.Network_en: These stories are spreading like wildfire through the city.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些谣言迅速传遍了整座城市。

电影明星Hedy Lamarr通常也被记为展频传输技术概念的共同发明人。她和她的钢琴家在二战期间为这项技术申请到了专利。他们发现了用于钢琴演奏者控制频率跳动的这项技术，并且设想它在战争时期能作为提供安全通信的方法。这对夫妇没有提供任何钱来完成这项发明，而他们的专利权最终期满。Sylvania在二十世纪五十年代提出了一个相似的概念，并提出了“展频（spread spectrum）“这一术语。

entry.def: If you spread something somewhere, you open it out or arrange it over a place or surface, so that all of it can be seen or used easily.

example.ex: She spread a towel on the sand and lay on it...
example.tran: 她在沙滩上铺了一条毛巾，躺在上面。

example.ex: His coat was spread over the bed.

entry.tran: 伸出，张开,叉开(手臂、双手、手指、双腿等)
entry.def: If you spread your arms, hands, fingers, or legs, you stretch them out until they are far apart.

example.ex: Sitting on the floor, spread your legs as far as they will go without overstretching...
example.tran: 坐在地板上，在不要拉伤的前提下将双腿尽量分开。

example.ex: He stepped back and spread his hands wide. 'You are most welcome to our home.'
example.tran: 他往后退了一步，伸开双手。“非常欢迎你到我们家来。”

entry.def: If you spread a substance on a surface or spread the surface with the substance, you put a thin layer of the substance over the surface.

example.ex: Spread the mixture in the cake tin and bake for 30 minutes...
example.tran: 将混合物抹在蛋糕烤盘里，烘烤 30 分钟。

example.ex: A thick layer of wax was spread over the surface...
example.tran: 表面涂上了厚厚的一层蜡。

entry.def: Spread is a soft food which is put on bread.

example.ex: ...a wholemeal salad roll with low fat spread.
example.tran: 涂有低脂酱的全麦色拉面包卷

entry.def: If something spreads or is spread by people, it gradually reaches or affects a larger and larger area or more and more people.

example.ex: The industrial revolution which started a couple of hundred years ago in Europe is now spreading across the world.
example.tran: 两百多年前始于欧洲的工业革命目前正在向全世界传播。

example.ex: ...the sense of fear spreading in residential neighborhoods...
example.tran: 在住宅小区中蔓延的恐惧感

entry.def: If something such as a liquid, gas, or smoke spreads or is spread, it moves outwards in all directions so that it covers a larger area.

example.ex: Fire spread rapidly after a chemical truck exploded...
example.tran: 一辆装有化学品的卡车爆炸后，火势迅速蔓延。

example.ex: A dark red stain was spreading across his shirt...
example.tran: 一块深红色的污渍正在他的衬衫上渗开。

entry.tran: 将…分散(在一段时间内);分期做
entry.def: If you spread something over a period of time, it takes place regularly or continuously over that period, rather than happening at one time.

example.ex: There seems to be little difference whether you eat all your calorie allowance in one go, or spread it over the day...
example.tran: 不管你是一次性摄入全天的卡路里限量，还是在一天内分次摄入，结果好像没有多大差别。

example.ex: The course is spread over a five week period.
example.tran: 这门课将持续 5 周时间。

entry.def: If you spread something such as wealth or work, you distribute it evenly or equally.

example.ex: ...policies that spread the state's wealth more evenly...
example.tran: 更加平均地分配国家财富的政策

example.ex: The loss of jobs has been far more evenly spread across the regions than it was during the early 1980s.
example.tran: 失业数字在各地区之间的分布要比 20 世纪 80 年代初均衡多了。

entry.def: A spread of ideas, interests, or other things is a wide variety of them.

example.ex: A topic-based approach can be hard to assess in primary schools with a typical spread of ability...
example.tran: 因为学生的能力通常差异很大，基于话题的教学方法在小学里评估起来可能很难。

example.ex: We have an enormous spread of industries, mainly in the Home Counties and East Anglia.
example.tran: 我们拥有种类繁多的工业，主要位于伦敦周围各郡和东英吉利地区。

entry.tran: (尤指为某一特殊场合准备的)丰盛饭菜，盛宴
entry.def: A spread is a large meal, especially one that has been prepared for a special occasion.

entry.tran: (书籍、杂志、报纸中)横贯两版的篇幅
entry.def: A spread is two pages of a book, magazine, or newspaper that are opposite each other when you open it at a particular place.

example.ex: There was a double-page spread of a dinner for 46 people.
example.tran: 有一张横贯两版的、由 46 人参加的宴席的照片。

entry.def: Spread is used to refer to the difference between the price that a seller wants someone to pay for a particular stock or share and the price that the buyer is willing to pay.

example.ex: Market makers earn their livings from the spread between buying and selling prices.
example.tran: 做市商靠赚取买卖价差生存。

means.word_mean: 1. process or result of distributing or extending over a wide expanse of space
2. the opening of a subject to widespread discussion and debate
3. act of extending over a wider scope or expanse of space or time

auth_sentence.content: Even now and they're going to be spreading.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even now and they're going to be spreading.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even now and they're going to be spreading.

auth_sentence.content: There is news that little egrets are spreading north.
auth_sentence.res_content: There is news that little egrets are spreading north.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There is news that little egrets are spreading north.

auth_sentence.content: The treatment of media as a singular noun...is spreading.
auth_sentence.res_content: The treatment of media as a singular noun...is spreading.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The treatment of media as a singular noun...is spreading.

Sentence.sentence: His insistence on putting users first, and focusing on elegance and simplicity, has become deep-rooted in his own company, and is spreading to rival firms too.

Both strains quickly invaded local hospitals when needle sharing and other unhealthy practices ensured the rapid spreading of the infection by bringing people into contact with contaminated body fluids.
If the virus had been capable of spreading through the air, or if one infected person had unknowingly entered a large population center, Ebola might have become a worldwide epidemic
Hospital workers in at least one case deserted their workplace in panic, thus halting the administering of potentially unclean disease spreading injections, but Ebola has not disappeared.
